meanings.definition: A person born during the baby boom, typically between 1946 and 1964.
meanings.sent1: My grandparents are boomers who grew up in a time of great change.
meanings.sent2: Many boomers enjoy sharing stories of their youth with younger generations.
meanings.sent3: The boomers at the family reunion always have the best tales to tell.
meanings.sent4: In a sea of generations, the boomers stand out like sturdy oaks.
meanings.sent5: The boomers' experiences shape the world we live in today.

meanings.sent1: The thunderstorm outside produced booming sounds that shook the windows.
meanings.sent2: The fireworks display ended with a series of colorful booms in the night sky.
meanings.sent3: The boom of the bass at the concert made everyone jump in excitement.
meanings.sent4: The boom of the cannon signaled the start of the historical reenactment.
meanings.sent5: The boom of the waves crashing against the shore was both calming and powerful.

meanings.sent1: The boomers in the wildlife park were impressive with their size and strength.
meanings.sent2: The alpha male kangaroo, known as a boomer, led the group with confidence.
meanings.sent3: The boomer kangaroo hopped around the enclosure, showing off for the visitors.
meanings.sent4: The boomer's powerful legs propelled it effortlessly across the grassy plains.
meanings.sent5: The boomer's deep growl warned others to stay away from its territory.
